channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Trump Administration Just Relaxed Nuclear Safety Rules as Money Pours Into the Industry
item.description: The changes are akin to ‘taking a wrecking ball’ to safety and security regulations, an expert told NPR.

item.title: 2 of Elon Musk’s Companies Could Be Merging Ahead of $1.5 Trillion IPO
item.description: It’s another move to gain an edge in the AI race.

item.title: Hims’ Super Bowl Ad Cost $16 Million and Nearly a Year’s Worth of Burnout
item.description: Co-founder Andrew Dudum shares his approach to the biggest (and most expensive) marketing moment of the year.

item.title: Remove Tesla’s non-repeatable profits, and the stock has never been more expensive—now boasting a ‘core’ PE of 632
item.description: After subtracting the sale of credits and digital assets, Tesla booked just $2.28 billion in "bedrock," repeatable earnings.

item.title: ICE keeps getting slapped down by a George W. Bush-appointed, Antonin Scalia acolyte Republican judge in Minnesota
item.description: “ICE is not a law unto itself,” wrote Judge Patrick Schiltz, who has also asked ICE's acting director to explain why he shouldn't be held in contempt.

item.title: 31 Million Americans Use GLP‑1s but New Claims Suggest Patients Aren’t Being Warned About Serious Risks
item.description: Patients know about nausea and vomiting. Now, lawsuits are raising concerns about vision loss.

item.title: Pizza cutter-wielding FBI imposter tried to break Luigi Mangione out of jail, authorities say
item.description: Mark Anderson, 36, of Mankato, Minnesota, was arrested and charged with impersonating an FBI agent.

item.title: Undoing DOGE: Inside the Ambitious Plan to Clean Up the Damage
item.description: A group of former government workers are developing a day-one plan for the next administration.

item.title: Only 4 democracies have created paramilitary police squads since 1960—if you include ICE
item.description: Nigeria, Honduras and Brazil are now joined by the U.S., with ICE meeting many or all of the definitions of paramilitary police.

item.title: The saga of the billion-dollar sock: The Muppets’ 50th birthday marks a long and profitable run
item.description: Muppets, a portmanteau of marionette and puppet, first appeared on TV in the Washington, D.C., region in 1955.

item.title: When to expect your tax refund from the IRS
